DOC.detailed_description: Most suicide attempt sign great distress , often originate depression ; physical sexual abuse ; substance abuse ; family history suicide , violence , mental disorder . Risk factor suicidal behavior diverse , differ gender , age , ethnicity . Since mid-1980s , number report suicide suicidal thought among young black individual increase alarmingly . The high rate may cause high stress living situation attribute poverty , abuse , discrimination , racism , difficult family life . Therefore , cultural environment , social situation , intrapersonal influence important consideration develop effective therapy prevent suicide . This study evaluate effect culturally competent psychoeducational empowerment session treat suicidal African-American woman abusive relationship . The participant single-blind study randomly place one two treatment group . One group receive psychoeducational intervention ( PEI ) receive enhance treatment usual ( ETAU ) . After screen , eligible participant complete 2-hour survey life event , concern , feeling research team member . One week later , participant complete second 1-hour survey . Participants randomly place treatment group . Participants group receive treatment Grady Health System , PEI group also attend 10 weekly , 90-minute group session . The PEI empowerment group session incorporate cultural , social , intrapersonal element . The ETAU group give mental health treatment usual plus adherence enhancement protocol . Follow-up survey occur Week 10 ( treatment completion ) Months 6 12 post-treatment .
